description:
Oga Tatsumi is a first year student in Ishiyama High, a notorious school for delinquents. One day he sees a man floating by, and the man suddenly splits in half to reveal a baby boy inside!

(Source: Crunchyroll)

__Birth Name:__ Nakagawa (中川) Shiyōko (しようこ)
__Birth Place:__ Nakano, Tokyo, Japan 
__Nickname:__ Shokotan (しょこたん), Shokotasu (ショコタス)  
__Height:__ 156cm  
__BWH:__ 84 - 58 - 84 cm

[Official Website](http://www.nakagawashoko.com/) | [Other Website]( http://shokoland.excite.co.jp/) | [Blog](http://ameblo.jp/nakagawa-shoko/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/shoko55mmts/) | [Sony Music Profile](http://www.sonymusic.co.jp/Music/Arch/SR/ShokoNakagawa/) | [Watanabe Entertainment Profile](http://www.watanabepro.co.jp/mypage/artist/nakagawashoko.html)

She is a Japanese idol, tarento, actress, seiyū (voice actor), illustrator and singer. She is the daughter of [Katsuhiko Nakagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/265314), a celebrity in Japan in the 1980s.

__[Website](http://www.flow-official.jp/)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCLakaKEelmUdqQISLjwIRmg)__ | __[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/FLOWofficial.music)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/FLOW_official)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/FLOW_OFFICIAL_JAPAN/)__

FLOW is a Japanese rock band that formed in 1998 and is signed on to Sony Music Japan's Ki/oon Records label. Flow is a five-piece band made up of two vocalists, a drummer, a bassist and a guitarist.

__Members:__
- [Keigo Hayashi](https://anilist.co/staff/227206/Keigo) (林圭吾) | KEIGO  - Vocalist
- [Kohshi Asakawa](https://anilist.co/staff/160032) (浅川甲史) | KOHSHI - Vocalist, Occasional rhythm guitarist
- [Takeshi Asakawa](https://anilist.co/staff/160033) (浅川岳史) | TAKE  - Lead Guitarist
- Hiroshi Iwasaki | IWASAKI (岩崎博詞) - Drummer
- Yasutaro Gotou | GOT'S (後藤康太郎) - Bass
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/bang20140617)

**[Twitter](https://twitter.com/cunepero)**

Kojima got started in the industry one day while he was working as a freelancer in various industries and somehow ended up with a job in anime at the age of 23.

His first project was on the show "[Shima Shima Tora no Shimajirou](https://anilist.co/anime/9768/Shima-Shima-Tora-no-Shimajirou/)" under [Studio Kikan](https://anilist.co/studio/256/Studio-Kikan), where he got started of by doing in-between animation. At the time he was very unexperienced with anime production and has [said](https://www.arabnews.jp/article/arts-culture/article_26145/) he likely would have been fired for his lack of knowledge and poor quality work, if not for the in-between animation checker teaching him everything from scratch.

Later down the line after establishing himself more in the anime industry, he would go on to work on "[Gurren Lagann](https://anilist.co/anime/2001/Tengen-Toppa-Gurren-Lagann/)" as a challenge to himself, where he would put forth mecha and effects animation he had no idea how to prior.

Kojima [states](https://www.arabnews.jp/article/arts-culture/article_26145/) he feels a lot of inspiration from manga artists who are able to think about a story, break it up into panels, and express it in pictures. He has thought about drawing a manga himself, even if it's something simple.

Some of his favorite anime are "[Inital D](https://anilist.co/anime/185/Initial-D/)," "[Natsume's Book of Friends](https://anilist.co/anime/4081/Natsume-Yuujinchou/)," "[Re:ZERO -Starting Life in Another World-](https://anilist.co/anime/21355/ReZero-kara-Hajimeru-Isekai-Seikatsu/)," "[Neon Genesis Evangelion](https://anilist.co/anime/30/Shin-Seiki-Evangelion/)," "[A KITE](https://anilist.co/anime/320/A-KITE/)," "[JIN-ROH](https://anilist.co/anime/570/JINROH/)," "[FLCL](https://anilist.co/anime/227/FLCL/)" and "[Doukyuusei -Classmates-](https://anilist.co/anime/21096/Doukyuusei/)."

Some of his favorite manga are "[HI Score Girl](https://anilist.co/manga/74501/Hi-Score-Girl/)" and "[A White Rose in Bloom](https://anilist.co/manga/108360/Mejirobana-no-Saku/)."

[Blog](http://nailwonder.blog44.fc2.com/) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/梅津泰臣) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yasuomi_Umetsu)

Best known for creating [Kite](https://anilist.co/anime/320/), a cult classic film, and its sequels.

After graduating from university, Umetsu began his career at Tsuchida Production, and later switched to Toei Animation, where he became particularly influenced by [Masami Suda](https://anilist.co/staff/115737/) of [Hokuto no Ken](https://anilist.co/anime/967/) fame.

In 1998, the adult animation [Kite](https://anilist.co/anime/320/) gained a lot of support not only in Japan but also in Hollywood. In 1999, he worked on Castlevania 64 and made the character illustrations for the game. Umetsu released [Mezzo Forte](https://anilist.co/anime/221/) in 2000, [Mezzo](https://anilist.co/anime/222/) in 2004 and [Kite Liberator](https://anilist.co/anime/3323/) in 2008. In 2009, Umetsu had several projects on his hands, most notably an anime film titled [Kiss and Cry](https://anilist.co/anime/101704/). The film took nearly five years to complete.

[Blog](http://nailwonder.blog44.fc2.com/) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/梅津泰臣) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yasuomi_Umetsu)

Best known for creating [Kite](https://anilist.co/anime/320/), a cult classic film, and its sequels.

After graduating from university, Umetsu began his career at Tsuchida Production, and later switched to Toei Animation, where he became particularly influenced by [Masami Suda](https://anilist.co/staff/115737/) of [Hokuto no Ken](https://anilist.co/anime/967/) fame.

In 1998, the adult animation [Kite](https://anilist.co/anime/320/) gained a lot of support not only in Japan but also in Hollywood. In 1999, he worked on Castlevania 64 and made the character illustrations for the game. Umetsu released [Mezzo Forte](https://anilist.co/anime/221/) in 2000, [Mezzo](https://anilist.co/anime/222/) in 2004 and [Kite Liberator](https://anilist.co/anime/3323/) in 2008. In 2009, Umetsu had several projects on his hands, most notably an anime film titled [Kiss and Cry](https://anilist.co/anime/101704/). The film took nearly five years to complete.

9nine (pronounced as "nine") was a 9 person unit formed in 2005, under LesPros entertainment. They are a cluster of colourful personality, who are already actively participating in the media scene as magazine models, actresses and variety regulars. The group has been hiatus since 2019.

__Current Members:__
• [Uki Satake](https://anilist.co/staff/118492/) (佐武宇綺)
• [Hirona Murata](https://anilist.co/staff/347423/) (村田寛奈)

__Previous Members:__
• Azusa Matsuzawa (松沢梓)
• Miwako Wagatsuma (我妻三輪子)
• Ruby Katou (加藤瑠美)
• Marie Ashida (芦田万莉恵)
• Mai Yoshida (吉田茉以)

• Kanae Yoshii (吉井香奈恵)
• [Sayaka Nishiwaki](https://anilist.co/staff/347402) (西脇彩華)

Three members of AKB48's Team A have formed a unit called **No Sleeves** (ノースリーブス), which is abbreviated as “no3b.” The group consists of Haruna Kojima (小嶋陽菜), Minami Takahashi (高橋みなみ), and Minami Minegishi (峯岸みなみ).
Nozomi Sasaki is a Japanese Actress and Model.
MBLAQ is a South Korean quintet boy band created by Korean entertainer Rain under J.Tune Camp. The group consists of Seungho, G.O., Lee Joon, Cheondoong/Thunder, and Mir.

**Residency:** Tokyo, Japan
**Graduated:** Aichi Institute of Technology

**[Blog (JP)](https://ameblo.jp/masatomo-ota/)** | **[Artist Profile (First Call Music)](https://firstcallmusic.net/artist/%e5%a4%aa%e7%94%b0%e9%9b%85%e5%8f%8b/)** | **[Twitter](https://twitter.com/masatomoota)**

**Masatomo Oota** is a Japanese guitarist and musician, who does composition and arrangement for anime. He is a part of the two-piece music unit [SCREEN mode](https://anilist.co/staff/119992/SCREEN-mode), and has been since 2013.
Lc5 is a visual kei major band formed in 2010 in Tokyo, Japan.  The band has 5 members, Miku (vocals), Reo (guitar), 夢時 (guitar), Sato (bass) and Aki (drums).
